1.brief: to rebel; hence (through the idea of maltreating) to whip, i.e. lash (self with wings, as the ostrich in running)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to rage or be violent; by implication, to suppress, to maltreat

2.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose

3.brief: a head person (of any rank or class)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
(causative) to bone, i.e. denude (by extensive, craunch) the bones
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

4.brief: to bubble up or froth (as boiling water), i.e. (figuratively) to be unimportant
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to be violent; by implication, to maltreat
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch

5.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to arrange as a battle, a vineyard (to hoe); hence, to muster and so to miss (or find wanting)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol

6.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
an angle; by implication, a pinnacle; figuratively, a chieftain
to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
to chase; by implication, to desolate
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

7.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity

8.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, to adhere to; hence, to await
an oracle
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
booty

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

to grasp, i.e. collect

strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)

a burning of anger
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

jealousy or envy
to eat (literally or figuratively)

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
near, with or among; often in general, to
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
the neck (between the shoulders) as the place of burdens; figuratively, the spur of ahill
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

10.brief: properly, a region across; but used only adverbially (with or without a preposition) on the opposite side (especially of the Jordan; ususally meaning the east)
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
Cush (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ham, and of his territory; also of an Israelite
incense (as increasing to a volume of smoke); hence  a worshipper
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)

properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
